intro: Elaeagia uxpanapensis, commonly known as the Mexican beach elder, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils near the shoreline. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Elaeagia uxpanapensis is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate moderate drought conditions.
